Matrix

2D Matrix operation used for geometric transform of any shape.

Author

SÃ©bastien Gruhier, http://www.xilinus.com

License

MIT-style license.

Summary
Matrix2D Matrix operation used for geometric transform of any shape.
Class Methods
multiplyMultiply 2 matrix
translateCreate a translation matrix
rotateCreate a rotate matrix
scaleCreate a scale matrix
rotateAtCreate a rotate matrix at a specific rotation center
scaleAtCreate a scale matrix at a specific center
invertInverts a matrix
Instance Methods
initializeConstructor.
mutliplyRightMultiply this matrix by another one to the right (this * matrix)
mutliplyLeftMultiply this matrix by another one to the left (matrix * this)
multiplyPointMultiply a point
multiplyBoundsMultiply a bound area (x, y, w, h)
valuesGets matrix values (xx, yx, xy, yy, dx, dy)
setValuesSets matrix values (xx, yx, xy, yy, dx, dy) with an array
hashValuesGets matrix values (xx, xy, yx, yy, dx, dy)

Class Methods

multiply

multiply: function(left,
right)

Multiply 2 matrix

Parameters

leftLeft matrix
rightRight matrix

Returns

A new matrix result of left multiply by right

translate

translate: function(x,
y)

Create a translation matrix

Parameters

xX translation value
yY translation value

Returns

A new matrix

rotate

rotate: function(angle)

Create a rotate matrix

Parameters

aangle in degree

Returns

A new matrix

scale

scale: function(sx,
sy)

Create a scale matrix

Parameters

sxx scale factor
syy scale factor (default sy = sx)

Returns

A new matrix

rotateAt

rotateAt: function(angle,
x,
y)

Create a rotate matrix at a specific rotation center

Parameters

aangle in degree
xX coordinate of rotation center
yY coordinate of rotation center Returns: A new matrix

scaleAt

scaleAt: function(sx,
sy,
x,
y)

Create a scale matrix at a specific center

Parameters

sxx scale factor
syy scale factor
xX coordinate of scale center
yY coordinate of scale center Returns: A new matrix

invert

invert: function(matrix)

Inverts a matrix

Parameters

matrixmatrix to invert

Returns

A new matrix

Instance Methods

initialize

initialize: function(values)

Constructor.  Creates a identity matrix by default

Parameters

valuesHash tables with matrix values: keys are xx, xy, yx, yy, dx, dy

Returns

A new matrix

mutliplyRight

Multiply this matrix by another one to the right (this * matrix)

Parameters

matrixRight matrix

Returns

this

mutliplyLeft

Multiply this matrix by another one to the left (matrix * this)

Parameters

matrixLeft matrix

Returns

this

multiplyPoint

multiplyPoint: function(x,
y)

Multiply a point

Parameters

xx coordinate
yy coordinate

Returns

{x:, y:}

TODO: unit test

multiplyBounds

multiplyBounds: function(bounds)

Multiply a bound area (x, y, w, h)

Parameters

boundshas table {x:, y:, w:, h:}

Returns

{x:, y:, w:, h:}

TODO: unit test

values

values: function()

Gets matrix values (xx, yx, xy, yy, dx, dy)

Returns

An array of 6 float values: xx, yx, xy, yy, dx, dy

setValues

setValues: function(array)

Sets matrix values (xx, yx, xy, yy, dx, dy) with an array

Parameters

array- An array of 6 float values: xx, yx, xy, yy, dx, dy

Returns

this

hashValues

hashValues: function()

Gets matrix values (xx, xy, yx, yy, dx, dy)

Returns

An hash table {xx: , xy: , yx: , yy: , dx: , dy: };
